Title: SEC-1946: User's authentication is lost when redirect by tomcat on a 404
Body:
[Suryakand Shinde](https://jira.spring.io/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=suryakand@gmail.com) (Migrated from [SEC-1946](https://jira.spring.io/browse/SEC-1946)) said:

Here is a bug that has been reported earlier also:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/546447/acegi-authentication-available-in-tomcat-404-error-handler

Here is my use case:
1) I have an application that contains few authenticated pages under /home/*. I am showing Welcome message for logged in users on all page if user is already logged in. To fetch logged in user's information I am using <security:authentication property="principal.firstName" />
2) I have setup in my web.xml to handle 404 error codes like:
    <error-page>
        <error-code>404</error-code>
        <location>/pagenotfound.html</location>
    </error-page>
3) When I am trying to access a page that is not available in my application I am correctly getting redirect to /pagenotfound.html but, the user information is lost (i.e. <security:authentication property="principal.firstName" />). Now if I access any valid page I can am able to get the user information back.

So the issue is with 404 redirect, somewhere during redirect user's information is getting removed from context and is unavailbale for <security:authentication /> taglib.

Is that possible with FS?

Title: partial views with options from session lead to JSON.stringify error (circular reference)
Body:
Some steps to reproduce (in Express v2.5.8)

1) Create a new project with session support (what I did)
2) Add a route that saves something to req.session (Memory)
3) pass that value to res.render () to a view that contains a partial for the type saved in the session. In my example:

some code:

app.js

```
app.get('/', function (req, res) {
    req.session.user = {username:'dan', password:'ASDF'};
    res.render('index', { title: 'Express' });
});

app.get('/test', function (req, res) {
    res.render("test.jade", {title:'test', user:req.session.user});
});
```

test.jade

```
p User details:
!= partial('user', user)
```

_user.partial

```
p User Partial : #{user.username}, - #{user.password}
```

Initially, I got the following when trying to render the view, test.jade: 

```
node.js:201
        throw e; // process.nextTick error, or 'error' event on first tick
          ^
TypeError: Converting circular structure to JSON
    at Object.stringify (native)
    at Array.0 (/home/dan/development/aqp/node_modules/express/node_modules/connect/lib/middleware/session    /memory.js:77:31)
    at EventEmitter._tickCallback (node.js:192:40)
```

after some digging, I found that I narrowed this down to renderPartial() in express/lib/view.js.

The problem, as I understand it, is that because parentLocals (in this case the session?) appears to be utils.union()'ed with the partial's object, user, causing a circular reference.

I am willing to admit that I am pretty new to node.js in general, so I could really just be using the tools wrong.

Title: Multiple Calls to viewWillAppear viewDidAppear...  iOS5.1
Body:
Is anyone aware of an issue with iOS5.1 (possibly 5.0) and the viewController logic of MyLauncher which results in multiple calls to viewWillAppear and viewDidAppear etc?  

This problem is of course causing issues with my code!

Here's log from most recent build of myLauncher on XCode 4.3.2 iOS5.1 simulator: 
(open launcher item1 and close it)

2012-03-11 22:52:23.024 MyLauncher[7179:f803] MyLauncherViewController - viewWillAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:23.074 MyLauncher[7179:f803] MyLauncherViewController - viewDidAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:24.192 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewWillAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:24.195 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewWillAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:24.197 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewDidAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:24.199 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewDidAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:24.201 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewDidDisappear
2012-03-11 22:52:24.202 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewDidAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:33.326 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewWillDisappear
2012-03-11 22:52:33.327 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewWillDisappear
2012-03-11 22:52:33.328 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewDidDisappear
2012-03-11 22:52:33.328 MyLauncher[7179:f803] MyLauncherViewController - viewWillAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:33.329 MyLauncher[7179:f803] MyLauncherViewController - viewDidAppear
2012-03-11 22:52:33.330 MyLauncher[7179:f803] ItemViewController - viewDidDisappear

I found the following question on StackOverFlow: 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7830830/ios-different-addsubview-behavior-between-ios-4-3-and-5-0

I think we need to update MyLauncher to account for this change in the way viewWill & Did appear with ChildViewControllers in iOS5 vs. iOS4!

Thanks!
repo_description: myLauncher 2 is an Objective-C iPhone and iPad Launcher based on the work done by rigoneri

Title: Creating a camera shows warnings
Body:
I'm using SimpleCV 1.2 with Ubuntu 12.04. Creating a camera without an argument results in a number of warnings:

```
>>> from SimpleCV import *
>>> cam = Camera()
VIDIOC_QUERYMENU: Invalid argument
VIDIOC_QUERYMENU: Invalid argument
VIDIOC_QUERYMENU: Invalid argument
>>> 
```

I would have expected this to be handled transparently (just give me the first camera you can find), unless I specify an argument (e.g. 0 or 1 for first or second camera). The same warnings show when I pass 0 as an argument, however.

On a side note, if you pass OpenCV's cv.CaptureFromCAM the argument -1, it [should](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4835146/capturing-webcam-stream-in-python-using-opencv-need-help/5265337#5265337) grab whatever camera it can get. I think SimpleCV instead passes OpenCV index 0 by default.
repo_description: The Open Source Framework for Machine Vision

Title: lein ring server throws error due to older version of hiccup
Body:
I'm using hiccup-1.0.1-beta1 with Clojure 1.3.0 and compojure 1.0.1

```
(defproject Tasks "1.0.0-SNAPSHOT"
  :description ""
  :dependencies [[org.clojure/clojure "1.3.0-beta1"]
                 [compojure "1.0.1"]
                 [hiccup "1.0.0-beta1"]]
  :dev-dependencies [[lein-ring "0.5.4"]]
  :ring {:handler tasks.core/app})
```

Using hiccup 1.0.1-beta1 with ring handler results in the below error:

```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalAccessError: defelem does not exist
    at clojure.core$refer.doInvoke(core.clj:3754)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.applyTo(RestFn.java:139)
    at clojure.core$apply.invoke(core.clj:602)
    at clojure.core$load_lib.doInvoke(core.clj:5243)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.applyTo(RestFn.java:142)
    at clojure.core$apply.invoke(core.clj:602)
    at clojure.core$load_libs.doInvoke(core.clj:5262)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.applyTo(RestFn.java:137)
    at clojure.core$apply.invoke(core.clj:604)
    at clojure.core$use.doInvoke(core.clj:5354)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.invoke(RestFn.java:408)
    at hiccup.page_helpers$eval430$loading__4531__auto____431.invoke(page_helpers.clj:1)
    at hiccup.page_helpers$eval430.invoke(page_helpers.clj:1)
    at clojure.lang.Compiler.eval(Compiler.java:6406)
```

This stackoverflow question says, it's because of ring-devel using an older version of hiccup-0.3.7.jar in lib/dev

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9572150/hiccup-1-0-0-beta1-error

After excluding hiccup in lein-ring:

```
 :dev-dependencies [[lein-ring "0.5.4" :exclusions [hiccup]]]
```

I'm still getting an error

```
Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: Could not locate hiccup/page_helpers__init.class or hiccup/page_helpers.clj on classpath: 
    at clojure.lang.RT.load(RT.java:430)
    at clojure.lang.RT.load(RT.java:398)
    at clojure.core$load$fn__4636.invoke(core.clj:5377)
    at clojure.core$load.doInvoke(core.clj:5376)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.invoke(RestFn.java:408)
    at clojure.core$load_one.invoke(core.clj:5191)
    at clojure.core$load_lib.doInvoke(core.clj:5228)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.applyTo(RestFn.java:142)
    at clojure.core$apply.invoke(core.clj:602)
    at clojure.core$load_libs.doInvoke(core.clj:5262)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.applyTo(RestFn.java:137)
    at clojure.core$apply.invoke(core.clj:604)
    at clojure.core$use.doInvoke(core.clj:5354)
    at clojure.lang.RestFn.invoke(RestFn.java:482)
    at ring.middleware.stacktrace$eval96$loading__4531__auto____97.invoke(stacktrace.clj:1)
    at ring.middleware.stacktrace$eval96.invoke(stacktrace.clj:1)
    at clojure.lang.Compiler.eval(Compiler.java:6406)

```

Can you please fix this issue?

Title: SSMS Addin installer not quite working for updated 2012, need manual file copy
Body:
Hi there, 

I installed version 1.3.1 of the ssms addin, when i start ssms i dont see any formatting options. This seems to be related to the locatin of the .addin file. when i move the addin does work

The default location is:
C:\Users\Public\Documents\microsoft\MSEnvShared\AddIns

When i use:
C:\Users\joost\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\MSEnvShared\Addins
it works

I did a quick check with process monitor, and it seems ssms doesnt even look for C:\Users\Public\Documents\microsoft\MSEnvShared\AddIns, even though it seems to be a standard location for addins. Not sure if this is a problem on my machine only since i dont have any other machines with 2012 installed yet. But i just wanted to let you know

---

UPDATE (TaoK): This issue seems to be caused by the recent microsoft updates; the first boot of SSMS 2012 after the updates seems to change the Add-in folder search path specification ("HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\SQL Server Management Studio\11.0_Config\AutomationOptions\LookInFolders"), and always force it to a set of values that don't include the path the current SSMS Add-In setup package uses.

To work around this for the moment, manually move the Addin file from "C:\Users\Public\Documents\microsoft\MSEnvShared\AddIns" to "C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\SQL Server Management Studio\11.0\Addins\" (you may have to create this folder if you haven't already installed an add-in that uses it).

For XP, move from "C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\Microsoft\MSEnvShared\Addins" to "C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data\Microsoft\SQL Server Management Studio\11.0\Addins\".

This issue should be fixed in the installer within a few days.
repo_description: A small free .Net and JS library (with demo UI, command-line bulk formatter, SSMS/VS add-in, notepad++ plugin, winmerge plugin, and demo webpage) for reformatting and coloring T-SQL code to the user's preferences.

Title: Problem att lägga till spellista
Body:
Tack för en fin applikation, det är precis vad vi behöver här på kontoret. Vet att det var länge sedan det hände något här... Jag misstänker att det har blivit något tokigt med min installation #### OS: Mac OS X 10.5 #### Återskapa: 1. Title: Multi thread sqlite
Body: The flask-peewee tutorial should set the check_same_thread = False in the DB config before connecting to the sqlite3 database.

Title: setData() should call resizeCanvas()
Body: Setting the data implies that the data has changed and the canvas should be re-sized to fit
repo_description: A lightning fast JavaScript grid/spreadsheet

Title: OpenUDID is not unique across devices
Body:
Suppose that a user has your application installed on device A. The user then buys a new device, device B. The user creates a backup of device A using iTunes and then restores it onto device B. 

When the user launches your application on device B, it will report the same udid as device A because this information is read from NSUserDefaults (which was copied from device A to B during the backup/restore).
repo_description: [OpenUDID IS NOW DEPRECATED] Open source initiative for a universal and persistent UDID solution for iOS

Title: CORS headers for HTTP errors
Body:
See http://www.w3.org/wiki/Talk:CORS_Enabled

It is important that CORS headers are also added in case of error. Currently the header is only visible for HTTP 200 responses. If possible, please also add them to other responses.

For example: if I open: https://dev.mobilizingcs.org/app/config/foo I get a response HTTP 405 method not allowed. But because the header is missing, a cross domain web client will not be able to see this response.
repo_description: The ohmage server application.
bio: Postdoc hacker for @ropensci at UC Berkeley

Title: changing trigger events on existing tooltip
Body:
Hi there. I have a help tooltip that I want to be able to control how it is opened. I would like default to be click and mouseover, once it has been opened once I would like it to be only click unless someone makes a mistake, then I would like it to go back to click and mouseover . 

The initial set-up is easy thanks to the event system (def: "mouseenter click, mouse leave"). I have even managed to unbind the mouseenter event with this:

```
$("#help-button").data("tooltip").getTrigger().unbind('mouseenter');
```

The issue is I can't rebind mouse enter the same way.. I tried 

```
$("#help-button").data("tooltip").getTrigger().bind('mouseenter');
```

but this does nothing.

Could someone help me with binding a trigger event to a tooltip that has already been established?

Cheers,

whiteatom

Title: Pickled TrialHandler Backwards Compatibility
Body:
Hi all,

When Jon updated TrialHandler to inherit from _BaseTrialHandler (somewhere around 34a14ad154, end of January) it broke the unpickling/loading, which was then fixed by Rebecca Sharman in 5b7efa7f54. 

However, that fix isn't backward compatible, so any TrialHandlers that were pickled with the older version (I think 1.73.02) can only be unpickled by that version and earlier. Here's the failing output when trying to unpickle files made with the earlier version using current versions (1.73.05, HEAD):

TypeError: ('object.**new**(X): X is not a type object (classobj)', <function _reconstructor at 0x1ef870>, (<class psychopy.data.TrialHandler at 0x6780308>, <type 'object'>, None))

Rebecca's fix was to remove object inheritance from _BaseTrialHandler in data.py: 

-class _BaseTrialHandler(object):
+class _BaseTrialHandler:

I don't understand python's inheritance well enough to know what's going when. My guess is that the pickled TrialHandler wasn't saved inheriting from anything, and doesn't think it needs to inherit from anything, but the newer version of TrialHandler thinks it should and is failing when it's not given a _BaseTrialHandler. But that's completely a guess.

In any case, we should be able to load older saved data using newer versions, especially since this was just a patch release. Can someone explain what's going on? And give me guidance on fixing it? I thought about using a try: except TypeError, but I don't know how to fix it without re-writing the method definition above.

Title: Add ability to create new blurb versions via JSON API

I'd like to be able to mix copycopter with some inline edit gem so that my clients can modify them inline on the copycopter client app.

I think that probably the best way to accomplish this is to ping copycopter with POST requests and GET back the updated text, but I don't see that there is an existing way to do this.

http://localhost:3000/assets?controller=alchemy%2Fadmin%2Fnewsletters (correct: /admin/newsletters)

Sometimes a page reload solves this, sometimes not...

This report serves like a reminder for me to dig deeper when it occurs next time.

Thank you:)

Title: ruby: Add regexes, `%Q{}` strings, bug fixes
Body:
Hi Craig,

I missed regexes, so here they are now. Also, I rounded up a few corner cases. Let me know if there's anything you want me to change. In particular I wasn't sure if you wanted the unit test. Also, wasn't sure if the "helper function" approach was right.

---

New features:
1. Regexes (`//` and `%r{}` forms)
2. Custom-quoted strings (`%Q{}`, `%q{}`, etc)
3. "unit test" demo: `demos/ruby-test.html`

Bug fixes:
1. Heredocs now start on the next free line. Previously, in `foo(<<EOF)`, the last parens was mistakenly colored as part of the heredoc text.
2. `{` is now allowed to open strings and symbols. Previously, `{:key => 'value'}` and `{'key' => 'value'}` would not color `key` correctly.
repo_description: Simple syntax highlighting library written in javascript

Title: CLJS Sources should be looked up in CLASSPATH and :source-path
Body:
In Maven (therefore in Leiningen too) both JAR and ZIP are valid artifact types. A JAR file can contain .class files, .clj files or other resource files. A ZIP file can contain resource files. Resources may also include .cljs files among other things. CLJS files can be distributed in source form via JAR and ZIP files uploaded to Maven repos.

Hence, it makes sense to pick up CLJS source files from CLASSPATH as well as from the source directory specified by `:cljsbuild ==> :builds ==> :source-path`. While looking up, the actual name of the file e.g. `foo/bar.cljs` should be used.

Title: STI table organization
Body:
The STI table minimum is `id` and `type` fields. And in Rails docs mentioned that you should add `type` to all of your indexes in such table, but why initial table creation does not do this with `PRIMARY KEY` ?

Talking about MySQL version (any other DB should handle this well too) I have to do

``` ruby
    create_table(:sti_objects, id: false) do |t|
      t.integer :id
      t.string  :type

      #... my fields

      t.timestamps
    end

    ActiveRecord::Base.connection.execute "ALTER TABLE `messages` ADD PRIMARY KEY (`id`, `type`)"
    ActiveRecord::Base.connection.execute "ALTER TABLE `messages` MODIFY `id` INT AUTO_INCREMENT"

```

This makes my primary key not only by `id` but on `type` too, which better reflects STI idea and _should_ improve performance on some queries.

**BUT** this works well with other AR infrastructure **only** if I overload root `StiObject` class method `primary_key` as:

``` ruby
class StiObject < ActiveRecord::Base

  def self.primary_key
    'id'
  end
end

```

In other case nothing works, because Rail's AR cannot work with multi-column primary keys as they should be in case of STI by default.

All this investigation was done with Rails 3.2.2 - may there be any changes or I'm wrong in some basic ideas of STI and DB performance?
repo_description: Ruby on Rails

Title: STI table organization
Body:
The STI table minimum is `id` and `type` fields. And in Rails docs mentioned that you should add `type` to all of your indexes in such table, but why initial table creation does not do this with `PRIMARY KEY` ?

Talking about MySQL version (any other DB should handle this well too) I have to do

``` ruby
    create_table(:sti_objects, id: false) do |t|
      t.integer :id
      t.string  :type

      #... my fields

      t.timestamps
    end

    ActiveRecord::Base.connection.execute "ALTER TABLE `messages` ADD PRIMARY KEY (`id`, `type`)"
    ActiveRecord::Base.connection.execute "ALTER TABLE `messages` MODIFY `id` INT AUTO_INCREMENT"

```

This makes my primary key not only by `id` but on `type` too, which better reflects STI idea and _should_ improve performance on some queries.

**BUT** this works well with other AR infrastructure **only** if I overload root `StiObject` class method `primary_key` as:

``` ruby
class StiObject < ActiveRecord::Base

  def self.primary_key
    'id'
  end
end

```

In other case nothing works, because Rail's AR cannot work with multi-column primary keys as they should be in case of STI by default.

All this investigation was done with Rails 3.2.2 - may there be any changes or I'm wrong in some basic ideas of STI and DB performance?
repo_description: Ruby on Rails

Title: エアロスナップで場所を覚える
Body:
終了時の場所を保存するように設定していても、Windows 7 のエアロスナップで
ウィンドウサイズを変えた場合にウィンドウ位置が復元されない。

最大化状態で終了すると最大化状態で起動されるのだから、
エアロスナップの位置も記憶して欲しい。

[スナップ - Windows 7 の機能 - Microsoft Windows](http://windows.microsoft.com/ja-JP/windows7/products/features/snap)
### ウィンドウサイズの記録処理
1. WM_DESTROY で `environ::save_geometry ()` を実行。
2. [GetWindowPlacement 関数](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/library/cc364767.aspx) で
    [WINDOWPLACEMENT 構造体](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/library/kb89946z.aspx) を取得
3. `rcNormalPosition` の left, top, right, bottom と showCmd を記録
   
   ``` ini
   [Misc]
   1440x900=(99,105)-(1435,903),3
   ```

showCmd の意味は以下のとおり。

``` c
/*
 * ShowWindow() Commands
 */
#define SW_HIDE             0
#define SW_SHOWNORMAL       1
#define SW_NORMAL           1
#define SW_SHOWMINIMIZED    2
#define SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED    3
#define SW_MAXIMIZE         3
#define SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE   4
#define SW_SHOW             5
#define SW_MINIMIZE         6
#define SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE  7
#define SW_SHOWNA           8
#define SW_RESTORE          9
#define SW_SHOWDEFAULT      10
#define SW_FORCEMINIMIZE    11
#define SW_MAX              11
```

最大化状態も保存しているので起動後は最大化状態が復元される。
### 原因

エアロスナップでウィンドウサイズを変更した場合は、
GetWindowPlacement はスナップ前の位置を返す。
そのため、スナップしたサイズを保存できていなかった。
なお、スナップ後のサイズは GetWindowRect で取得できる。

c++ - GetWindowPlacement gives the incorrect window position - Stack Overflow
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5673242/getwindowplacement-gives-the-incorrect-window-position
### 対応

一時的にエアロスナップで縦半分に表示する場合もあると思うので、
位置を保存するかどうかは設定できるようにする。
- 共通設定→さまざまに以下の設定を追加
  
  ```
  □終了時にウィンドウサイズを保存
    □エアロスナップで変更した場合も保存
  ```
- 「終了時にウィンドウサイズを保存」のチェックを外した場合は、
  disable する
- エアロスナップで位置を保存する場合、GetWindowRect でウィンドウ位置を
  取得して WINDOWPLACEMENT 構造体の rcNormalPosition に設定する
- xyzzy.ini の書式は変更しない
### 備考
- Windows Vista 以前ではこのオプションを常に無効化したかったが、
  menu とは違い enable/disable の切り替えに任意の関数を指定できる
  わけではなさそうなので諦めた
repo_description: xyzzy 0.2.2 系列。有志により開発が継続中です。

Title: Respect "overflow: scroll;" and "overflow-y: scroll;"
Body:
If the scrollable element has "overflow: scroll;" or "overflow-y: scroll;" the slider should be visible and have the height to fill the whole slider pane, "even if there is nothing to scroll".

**Normal, doesn't matter if it's "overflow: auto;" or "overflow: scroll;"**

![Normal](http://snaps.alicanc.com/2012-03-12_215248.png)

**There is nothing to scroll, the slider should be still shown if it's "overflow: scroll;" or "overflow-y: scroll;"**

![Nothing to scroll](http://snaps.alicanc.com/2012-03-12_215317.png)
repo_description: A jQuery plugin that offers a simplistic way of implementing Lion OS scrollbars.

Title: Flickr - would like to bypass (or at least auto fill) attributes dialog
Body:
I've posted this on StackOverflow but after a number of days I haven't received any advice on this issue.

[Link to SO post](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9659290/sharekit-flickr-integration-want-to-bypass-or-at-least-auto-fill-attribute)

Ideally I'd like to suppress the presentation of the dialog (i.e., send without further user interaction) or if that is not possible, at least fill in the Title, Description and Tag fields with the variables from my app allowing the user to add to or override the values. Note that if I toggle the "Auto Share" switch to "On" the dialog is _still_ presented next time through.

When presented with the dialog, if I don't enter values for the Title, Description and Tag fields the values that I specify in my app for the SHKItem object that I allocate _are_ passed up to Flickr and appear with the image. If I override the values in this dialog then the image displayed on Flickr has those values, which is not desirable in my use case.

For Flickr authentication I've set the consumer key, secret key and callback URL in the my  custom configuator file and put a matching URL Scheme in the URL Types/URL Identifier row in the info.plist.

Is there something I have missed in configuring this sharing service or other advice you can give me to accomplish what I want to do.

Thanks
repo_description: Drop in sharing features for all iPhone and iPad apps

Title: ghci and runghc fails
Body:
I'm trying to debug why ghci behaves differently than ghc. Here is a succinct example with the corresponding output https://gist.github.com/57df6f71fa1144ec20cf
- Loading the file within ghci and running main outputs: "Bus error: 10" after a few seconds
- Running the file with runhaskell or runghc silently fails after a few seconds
- Compiling with ghc works dandy.

(I edited the issue to embed the gist contents in case the gist gets removed somehow)

This isn't a huge priority, but it would be very nice to test leveldb code without having to compile the source every time.

```
-- in LevelDbTest.hs
import Database.LevelDB
import Data.Text as T
import Data.Text.Encoding as E
import Data.ByteString (ByteString)

main :: IO ()
main = do 
  withLevelDB "/tmp/leveldbtest" [CreateIfMissing, CacheSize 1024] $ \db -> do
    put db [] (encode "foo") (encode "bar")
    get db [] (encode "foo") >>= print


encode :: String -> ByteString
encode string = E.encodeUtf8 $ T.pack string
```

```
$ ghci
GHCi, version 7.0.4: http://www.haskell.org/ghc/  :? for help
Loading package ghc-prim ... linking ... done.
Loading package integer-gmp ... linking ... done.
Loading package base ... linking ... done.
Loading package ffi-1.0 ... linking ... done.
Prelude> :load LevelDbTest.hs 
[1 of 1] Compiling Main             ( LevelDbTest.hs, interpreted )
Ok, modules loaded: Main.
*Main> main
Loading package bytestring-0.9.1.10 ... linking ... done.
Loading package array-0.3.0.2 ... linking ... done.
Loading package filepath-1.2.0.0 ... linking ... done.
Loading package leveldb-haskell-0.0.2 ... linking ... done.
Loading package deepseq-1.3.0.0 ... linking ... done.
Loading package text-0.11.1.13 ... linking ... done.
Bus error: 10

$ runhaskell LevelDbTest.hs # same pause as ghci but silently finishes

$ ghc --make LevelDbTest.hs 
[1 of 1] Compiling Main             ( LevelDbTest.hs, LevelDbTest.o )
Linking LevelDbTest ...
ld: warning: could not create compact unwind for .LFB3: non-standard register 5 being saved in prolog

$ ./LevelDbTest # correct output
Just "bar"
```
repo_description: Haskell bindings to LevelDB (https://github.com/google/leveldb)

Title: Unrecognized field: usernameCanonical
Body:
Hello,
i receive this error when a try to use the login form.
Before the "bin/vendors update" was all right.
Now i'm using Symfony 2.0.11 and FOSUserBundle 1.2.0
The "auto_mapping: true" setting is disabled because i'm using multiple entity managers...

Here's my app/**frontend**/config/config.yml file (note that there is an additional subfolder):

```
imports:
    - { resource: parameters.ini }
    - { resource: security.yml }

framework:
    esi:             { enabled: true }
    translator:      { fallback: en }
    secret:          %secret%
    charset:         UTF-8
    router:          { resource: "%kernel.root_dir%/config/routing.yml" }
    form:            true
    csrf_protection: true
    validation:      { enable_annotations: true }
    templating:      { engines: ['twig'] } #assets_version: SomeVersionScheme
    session:
        default_locale: %locale%
        auto_start:     true

# Twig Configuration
twig:
    debug:            %kernel.debug%
    strict_variables: %kernel.debug%

# Assetic Configuration
assetic:
    debug:          %kernel.debug%
    use_controller: false
    # java: /usr/bin/java
    filters:
        cssrewrite: ~
        less:
            node: /usr/local/bin/node
            node_paths: [/usr/local/lib/node, /usr/local/lib/node_modules]
        yui_css:
            jar: %kernel.root_dir%/java/yuicompressor-2.4.7.jar
        yui_js:
            jar: %kernel.root_dir%/java/yuicompressor-2.4.7.jar

# Doctrine Configuration
doctrine:
  dbal:
    default_connection: italy
    connections:
      italy:
        driver:   %database_driver%
        host:     %database_host%
        port:     %database_port%
        dbname:   %database_name_italy%
        user:     %database_user%
        password: %database_password%
        charset:  UTF8
      world:
        driver:   %database_driver%
        host:     %database_host%
        port:     %database_port%
        dbname:   %database_name_world%
        user:     %database_user%
        password: %database_password%
        charset:  UTF8

  orm:
    auto_generate_proxy_classes: %kernel.debug%
    default_entity_manager: italy
    entity_managers:
      italy:
        connection: italy
        mappings:
          MobMindsCoreBundle: ~
          FOSUserBundle: ~
        metadata_cache_driver: apc
        query_cache_driver: apc
        result_cache_driver:
          type:           memcache
          host:           %memcache_host%
          port:           %memcache_port%
          instance_class: Memcache
          class:          Doctrine\Common\Cache\MemcacheCache
      world:
        connection: world
        mappings:
          MobMindsCoreBundle: ~
          FOSUserBundle: ~
        metadata_cache_driver: apc
        query_cache_driver: apc
        result_cache_driver:
          type:           memcache
          host:           %memcache_host%
          port:           %memcache_port%
          instance_class: Memcache
          class:          Doctrine\Common\Cache\MemcacheCache

# Swiftmailer Configuration
swiftmailer:
    transport: %mailer_transport%
    host:      %mailer_host%
    username:  %mailer_user%
    password:  %mailer_password%

jms_security_extra:
    secure_controllers:  true
    secure_all_services: false

fos_user:
  db_driver: orm
  firewall_name: main
  user_class: MobMinds\CoreBundle\Entity\User
  registration:
    confirmation: { enabled: true }
  from_email:
    address: no-reply@%domain%
    sender_name: %site_name% Staff
  resetting:
    token_ttl: %reset_password_ttl%
```

security.yml

```
security:
  providers:
    fos_userbundle:
      id: fos_user.user_manager

  encoders:
    FOS\UserBundle\Model\UserInterface:
      algorithm: sha512
      encode_as_base64: false
      iterations: 1

  firewalls:
    main:
      pattern: ^/
      form_login:
        provider: fos_userbundle
        csrf_provider: form.csrf_provider
      logout: true
      anonymous: true
      remember_me:
        key: %remember_me_secret%
        lifetime: %remember_me_lifetime%
        path: /
        domain: %remember_me_domain%
        always_remember_me: false

    dev:
      pattern:  ^/(_(profiler|wdt)|css|images|js)/
      security: false

  access_control:
    #- { path: ^/login, roles: IS_AUTHENTICATED_ANONYMOUSLY, requires_channel: https }
    - { path: ^/_internal, ip: 127.0.0.1 }
    - { path: ^/login$, role: IS_AUTHENTICATED_ANONYMOUSLY }
    - { path: ^/register, role: IS_AUTHENTICATED_ANONYMOUSLY }
    - { path: ^/resetting, role: IS_AUTHENTICATED_ANONYMOUSLY }
    - { path: ^/admin/, role: ROLE_ADMIN }

  role_hierarchy:
    ROLE_ADMIN:       ROLE_USER
    ROLE_SUPER_ADMIN: [ROLE_USER, ROLE_ADMIN, ROLE_ALLOWED_TO_SWITCH]
```

MobMinds\CoreBundle\Entity\User:

```
<?php

namespace MobMinds\CoreBundle\Entity;

use FOS\UserBundle\Entity\User as BaseUser;
use Doctrine\ORM\Mapping as ORM;

/**
 * @ORM\Entity
 * @ORM\Table(name="fos_user")
 */
class User extends BaseUser
{
    /**
     * @ORM\Id
     * @ORM\Column(type="integer")
     * @ORM\GeneratedValue(strategy="AUTO")
     */
    protected $id;
}
```

Thanks in advance

Title: Unique jobs middleware raising IOError: stream closed
Body:
I've never seen these in development. Once I went into production, though, the job that is queued most frequently has started occasionally throwing `IOError: stream closed`. Although it's happening while trying to work a specific job of mine, the backtrace doesn't include my worker at all. The error seems to be coming from the call that the unique jobs middleware makes to redis:

```
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/connection/ruby.rb:58:in `write'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/connection/ruby.rb:58:in `write'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:139:in `block (3 levels) in process'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:138:in `each'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:138:in `block (2 levels) in process'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:250:in `ensure_connected'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:137:in `block in process'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:206:in `logging'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:136:in `process'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis/client.rb:46:in `call'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis.rb:681:in `block in del'
/usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/monitor.rb:211:in `mon_synchronize'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-2.2.2/lib/redis.rb:680:in `del'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/redis-namespace-1.1.0/lib/redis/namespace.rb:214:in `method_missing'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/connection_pool-0.1.0/lib/connection_pool.rb:48:in `method_missing'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/server/unique_jobs.rb:8:in `call'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/chain.rb:73:in `block in invoke'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/server/logging.rb:9:in `call'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/chain.rb:73:in `block in invoke'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/server/exception_handler.rb:9:in `call'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/chain.rb:73:in `block in invoke'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/chain.rb:76:in `call'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/middleware/chain.rb:76:in `invoke'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/processor.rb:37:in `block in process'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/processor.rb:66:in `stats'
[GEM_ROOT]/bundler/gems/sidekiq-66c275f42f70/lib/sidekiq/processor.rb:36:in `process'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/celluloid-0.9.0/lib/celluloid/calls.rb:93:in `dispatch'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/celluloid-0.9.0/lib/celluloid/actor.rb:202:in `block in handle_message'
[GEM_ROOT]/gems/celluloid-0.9.0/lib/celluloid/task.rb:45:in `block in initialize'
```

I'm not sure exactly why this is happening, but the backtraces for all dozen exceptions are completely consistent -- the error raises inside `redis/connection/ruby.rb:58`, while further up the backtrace it is being called from `sidekiq/middleware/server/unique_jobs:8`. Any ideas?

Title: Double transitions with jqm 1.1-rc1 and phonegap 1.4.1 + fixed toolbars
Body:
I am running jQM 1.1.0-rc.1 with PhoneGap 1.4.1 on an iPad 1 running iOS 5.   I have created a very simple application that uses $.mobile.changePage to load a few web pages from a web server, using the flip transition.

If you view the same set of pages in mobile Safari, it works fine.  Transitions are smooth and look good.  However, doing the same thing inside PhoneGap, every transition happens twice.  First the originating page flips out of view, then the new page appears in whole without a transition, then the transition effect occurs on the new page.

I have created a video to demonstrate the effect: http://youtu.be/EDZ-FM_rWi0  Hopefully it is not too shaky.

I've created a code snippet at http://jsbin.com/eyufam/54 that shows the basic structure of the pages, however, you won't see the problem unless you are running it inside a PhoneGap application.

The PhoneGap application is barely more than the "Getting Started" app found at http://phonegap.com/start#ios-x4 except that I have a different index file and the required jQuery libraries.   I will try to attach to this ticket.

I had filed a similar issue earlier and then closed it because I thought it was my code.   But this time, none of my custom logic is part of the app.    I have determined that the double transitions only occur when I have a header with data-position="fixed" .  Take out the fixed header and it works ok.

I'm not sure whether to post the issue with jQM or with PhoneGap, but the effect was not noticeable until I went from jQM 1.0.1 to jQM 1.1.0-rc.1
repo_description: jQuery Mobile Framework

Title: How to trigger Facebook authentication from Visual Studio solution.
Body:
I am making good progress with my application built using Chaplin.  I am getting lists to display and I am currently working on editing my objects.  I want to thank you for building such an elegant framework.  I love backbone.js, but, I kept finding the need to fill in the missing gaps (e.g. controllers, disposing objects, pub/sub, etc.).  I am so happy I discovered Chaplin.

I develop in visual studio and I built a solution and migrated all the sample chaplin application files into it.  Because the sample Chaplin application has to be run using the mock domain chaplin.moviepilot.com I can not get the Facebook service provider to work when I run my visual studio application.  When running a visual studio application it just runs in localhost with a port number.  Eventually, I want to authenticate my users by using either Facebook, Gmail, Twitter, or allow them to create a user account.  Can you give some guidance on how I might run Facebook authentication without the need to use the mock domain chaplin.moviepilot.com?  So much depends on having an authenticated mediator.user that it is difficult for me to move forward.  

I have looked at the Facebook provider, however, I have to admit that it is beyond my skillset to understand right now.  I don't want to change the provider, I just want to enable my application to use the provider without running under the domain chaplin.moviepilot.com.  

Best regards,
Chris

I'm using this in a live project, and it works OK with our test files - but the extra code for transform support might have strange side-effects, so it's currently enabled/disabled with a #define (defaults to ENABLED)

Title: Issues with compression
Body:
Hi, 

First I would like to thank you for providing RequestReduce to the public. What a great tool you have created here! 

I have been testing it on my development machine, where everything seems to work fine. However, when I deploy to the production site, the results are not the same, and when I check the dashboard, I get errors like: "There were errors reducing http://mysite.com/css/main.css", "RequestReduce had problems accessing http://www.mysite.com/WebResource.axd?" and "RequestReduce expected url 'http://www.mysite.com/WebResource.axd?... to have a mime type of 'text/css' ". I have using both RadScriptManager (yes, we are using Telerik´s ASP .NET controls) and the stock ASP :NET ScriptManager, and get errors with both of them. 

Do you have any idea what could be the problem here? Our web hosting company uses IIS clusters with load balancing, could this have something to do these problems?

Best Regards
/Goran

In other words, page 4 started off with the question, "When it comes to social and political matters" do you think of yourself as ethnic.

Title: npm breaks on Windows when running off a UNC path
Body:
REPRO STEPS:
- create some UNC share on a different machine, e.g. `\\myserver\myshare\npmtest`
- In there, create a package.json with the following contents.
  
  {
        "name": "app"
      , "version": "0.0.1"
      , "private": true
      , "dependencies": {
          "mkdirp": "0.0.7"
      }
  }
- Open a PowerShell window, and cd to `\\myserver\myshare\npmtest`. We can't use cmd here because it doesn't support cd'ing to UNCs.
- In there, run the following command. Note that we can't use npm.cmd here because we're using a UNC. So we run node and use the npm js file explicitly:

`node "${env:ProgramFiles(x86)}\nodejs\node_modules\npm\bin\npm-cli.js" install`

RESULT:

It fails with the following error:

```
npm http GET https://registry.npmjs.org/mkdirp/0.0.7
npm http 304 https://registry.npmjs.org/mkdirp/0.0.7
npm ERR! error installing mkdirp@0.0.7
npm ERR! error rolling back mkdirp@0.0.7 Error: UNKNOWN, unknown error '\\myserver\myshare\npmtest\node_modules\mkdirp'

npm ERR! Error: ENOENT, no such file or directory '\\myserver\myshare\npmtest\node_modules\mkdirp\package.json'
npm ERR! You may report this log at:
npm ERR!     <http://github.com/isaacs/npm/issues>
npm ERR! or email it to:
npm ERR!     <npm-@googlegroups.com>
npm ERR!
npm ERR! System Windows_NT 6.1.7601
npm ERR! command "D:\\Dropbox\\util\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files (x86)\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install"
npm ERR! cwd \\myserver\myshare\npmtest
npm ERR! node -v v0.6.11
npm ERR! npm -v 1.1.1
npm ERR! path \\myserver\myshare\npmtest\node_modules\mkdirp\package.json
npm ERR! code ENOENT
npm ERR! message ENOENT, no such file or directory '\\myserver\myshare\npmtest\node_modules\mkdirp\package.json'
npm ERR! errno {}
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Additional logging details can be found in:
npm ERR!     \\myserver\myshare\npmtest\npm-debug.log
npm not ok
```

NOTE: the same works fine when not using UNC. Note that in our real scenario, we're launching this programmatically from an exe. The use of PS is just the isolated repro.

Full npm-debug.log contents are on http://pastie.org/pastes/3531428/text

Title: DrRacket does not preserve newline convention of original file
Body:
###### Originally submitted by Danny Yoo dyoo@hashcollision.org on: Thu Sep 29 12:56:01 -0400 2011

If I'm editing a file in DrRacket that has DOS-style newlines on my Ubuntu box, then DrRacket transparently translates the newlines to Unix convention.  This causes headaches in combination with traditional text diff tools.

``` racket
DrRacket should preserve the newline convention of existing files.
```
##### Release:

5.1.3
##### Environment:

Linux i686 / Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/14.0.835.186 Safari/535.1
###### This bug was converted from Gnats bug [12242](http://bugs.racket-lang.org/old/12242).

[anon-submit dyoo AT hashcollision.org]

Title: Add documentation and improved licensing fields to podspec
Body:
I'm suggesting to add this simple changes to `spec.rb` without introducing any new logic at the moment.
### Documentation

Adding a new field for pointing to the Atom link of the documentation set of the Pod. Something like:

```
s.documentation = 'http://zwaldowski.github.com/BlocksKit/com.dizzytechnology.BlocksKit.atom
```

Then in the future it would be nice if `pod install` would add the documentation set to Xcode according to an user preference. appledoc adds the local documentation by compying it and running the following script:

```
tell application "Xcode"
load documentation set with path #path#
end tell
```

I guess that the script could be easily modified to add the atom link.
### Licensing

Currently the podspec only specifies the kind of licence. It would be also nice to have a pointer to the license file itself. For example:

```
s.license_text = 'LICENSE'
```

In some cases like the ( facebook-ios-sdk)[https://github.com/facebook/facebook-ios-sdk] application a single license file is not provided. In that case it could be useful to specify the lines of a file containing the license. Something like:

```
s.license_text = 'src/FBConnect.h'
s.license_text_lines = '1..15'
```
